channel.title: NPR Programs: Morning Edition
channel.description: Morning Edition takes listeners around the country and the world with multi-faceted stories and commentaries every weekday. Hosts Steve Inskeep, Leila Fadel, Michel Martin and A Martínez bring you the latest breaking news and features to prepare you for the day.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Israeli forces begin pullback in Gaza after government agrees to ceasefire plan
item.description: After the Israeli government approved the first stage of President Trump's ceasefire plan, Israeli forces in Gaza began pulling back to agreed positions Friday.
item.content:encoded: After the Israeli government approved the first stage of President Trump's ceasefire plan, Israeli forces in Gaza began pulling back to agreed positions Friday.
item.dc:creator: Aya Batrawy

item.title: Israel and Hamas agree to ceasefire's first phase, but key challenges still lie ahead
item.description: Israel and Hamas agreed on the first phase of the ceasefire deal, but what challenges could they encounter next? NPR's Leila Fadel talks to former peace talks negotiator Diana Buttu.
item.content:encoded: Israel and Hamas agreed on the first phase of the ceasefire deal, but what challenges could they encounter next? NPR's Leila Fadel talks to former peace talks negotiator Diana Buttu.
item.dc:creator: Leila Fadel

item.title: Judge temporarily blocks National Guard deployment to Illinois
item.description: A federal judge temporarily blocked the Trump administration from deploying the National Guard to Illinois, expressing skepticism about the government's depiction of protests in a Chicago-area suburb.
item.content:encoded: A federal judge temporarily blocked the Trump administration from deploying the National Guard to Illinois, expressing skepticism about the government's depiction of protests in a Chicago-area suburb.
item.dc:creator: A Martínez

item.title: María Corina Machado of Venezuela awarded Nobel Peace Prize
item.description: The Norwegian Nobel Committee said Machado's work promoting democratic rights is "one of the most extraordinary examples of civilian courage in Latin America in recent times.
item.content:encoded: The Norwegian Nobel Committee said Machado's work promoting democratic rights is "one of the most extraordinary examples of civilian courage in Latin America in recent times.
item.dc:creator: Eleanor Beardsley

item.title: Sorry, dad! Colin Hanks says John Candy was the 'nicest guy in Hollywood'
item.description: John Candy was one of the most beloved comedic actors of his time, with starring roles in Planes, Trains and Automobiles and Uncle Buck. His life and work are celebrated in a new Amazon Prime documentary by Colin Hanks, John Candy: I Like Me.
item.content:encoded:
John Candy was one of the most beloved comedic actors of his time, with starring roles in Planes, Trains and Automobiles and Uncle Buck. His life and work are celebrated in a new Amazon Prime documentary by Colin Hanks, John Candy: I Like Me.

(Image credit: Prime Video)
item.dc:creator: Phil Harrell

item.title: Morning news brief
item.description: Israeli forces in Gaza begin pulling back to agreed positions after ceasefire deal, Trump planning to travel to Middle East ahead of hostage exchange, New York's AG indicted on federal charges.
item.content:encoded: Israeli forces in Gaza begin pulling back to agreed positions after ceasefire deal, Trump planning to travel to Middle East ahead of hostage exchange, New York's AG indicted on federal charges.
item.dc:creator: A Martínez

item.title: Government shutdown, text message scandal could reshape Virginia's gubernatorial race
item.description: Virginia is just weeks away from electing a new governor, but the government shutdown and a recent text message scandal could reshape the race.
item.content:encoded: Virginia is just weeks away from electing a new governor, but the government shutdown and a recent text message scandal could reshape the race.
item.dc:creator: Margaret Barthel

item.title: Loyola's Sister Jean, who became a March Madness icon, dies at 106
item.description: Sister Jean Dolores Schmidt, the beloved chaplain for the Loyola Chicago men's basketball team who became an international celebrity during their 2018 Final Four run, has died.
item.content:encoded:
Sister Jean Dolores Schmidt, the beloved chaplain for the Loyola Chicago men's basketball team who became an international celebrity during their 2018 Final Four run, has died.

(Image credit: Kevin C. Cox)
item.dc:creator: Adora Namigadde

item.title: Trump to travel to Middle East as Israel and Hamas prepare for hostage exchange
item.description: President Trump is planning to travel to the Middle East this weekend as Israel and Hamas prepare for a hostage and prisoner exchange as outlined in the ceasefire deal.
item.content:encoded: President Trump is planning to travel to the Middle East this weekend as Israel and Hamas prepare for a hostage and prisoner exchange as outlined in the ceasefire deal.
item.dc:creator: Deepa Shivaram

item.title: Can U.S.-brokered ceasefire deal between Israel and Hamas deliver lasting peace?
item.description: NPR's Leila Fadel speaks with veteran hostage negotiator Gershon Baskin about the Israel-Hamas ceasefire and President Trump's involvement in the agreement.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Leila Fadel speaks with veteran hostage negotiator Gershon Baskin about the Israel-Hamas ceasefire and President Trump's involvement in the agreement.
item.dc:creator: Leila Fadel
